Nah I don't think so! If someone can beat TSM, it would be Fnatic, and they will eventually do so! Bjergsen almost always lose vs EU mid laners, and TSM's only player who is stronger than his role counterpart is Wildturtle. And maybe Lustboy mechanically, but he is close with Yellowstar. I think Huni and Reignover will carry the game beetween these two teams, and I presume we will see some 1v1 kill from Febiven to Bjergsen.

Personally I think TSM are the more likely team to get the third semi spot out of those three. I think they have a pretty good coaching staff and infrastructure, and through many of their games during the split they were basically trying new things and testing out new comps and they just look much more consistent and controlled overall. I also don't think you can just straight up say Huni is better than dyrus considering he tend to get more resources put into him and Fnatic allow him to carry whereas Dyrus is kind of let to die while his team takes other objectives and gets Turtle/Bjerg going. Regrdless it will be interesting. We'll know in 2 weeks

Its sad that you would think that TSMs weakest player is the only role that TSM has better. Dyrus can be Huni. Reignover v Santorin is pretty even, though TSM doesn't put as much pressure on Santorin to carry his lanes out of the gutter. Feb v Bjerg belongs to the king the Bjergerking. 

All of this is moot. SKT/EDG get first/second prize moneys and Fnatic/TSM just fight over 3rd and 4th.

The one substitute thing is kinda bull like this really hurts the core thing with some of the Korean teams and I think it makes it harder to tell who the strongest team is atm. I believe SKT will be going to MSI and if they can't make full use of their substitutions it just hinders them which is unfair to them. This is essentially cutting SKT's team in half which is bullshit imo.

Different regions have different rules in regards to substitutes and besides, it will require regions like Korea who rely on multiple substitutions in their game series to really think through just how exactly they're going to play against the teams who don't have that luxury of sorts to switch out mid-series, as keep in mind that regions like Korea play BO2's in their regular season splits if I remember correctly there where as other regions such as NA and EU don't, so there's that at least.

If teams that heavily rely on multiple substitutions such as SKT want to prove to the world that they're a very strong team internationally, then they're just gonna have to learn how to adapt on the fly and work with what they have. Other regions can do just fine without having to use multiple substitutions a series, so if they can, then regions like Korea can do so too also, so there's that at least.
How are SKT supposed to MindF**K teams with Easyhoon/Tom in the first two matches then Faker/Bengi in the last 3! :(

Um, they're not?

Honestly I feel that this will require teams like SKT to really think about how they are going to set their roster for things like this as it requires allot more planning and strategy than what they normally use in their home leagues there, which isn't actually a bad thing to do there honestly, so there's that at least. Think of it this way, they're already a strong team as it is, so this will give them the chance to show the world just how powerful they are even if they can only bring one sub to events like MSI (providing that they even go to MSI anyways), so there's that at least.

I understand they are not, but that really limits the team. They have 2 primary subs for a reason. They have strategies they use with Easyhoon and with Faker. Same with Tom or Bengi.

I see this as limiting. Same goes for some of the LPL teams and making it easier for Wild Card/NA/EU teams at MSI.

That is possible if EDG or SKT/GE Tigers get 1st and 4th or someone get 2nd and 3rd. That wouldn't so much suck as it would force a different kind of grand finals. I think fans have grown accustomed to seeing Koreans and Chinese in the finals and anything else is somehow wrong. Back-to-back worlds having this for finals (with the same team on China's side no less) no doubt contributed to this.

Can you imagine that it is TSM/Fnatic in the grand finals and then them again in the grand finals at Worlds on Halloween?

No it isn't the fact that it is Chinese v Korean in the finals. It is the fact that in order for Korea or China to not get both first and second means that the brackets were setup in such a way that NA/EU didn't have to go against China or Korea to get to the finals, which means that the true grand final would have been the semis. 

Do you really think that NA or EU could get to Grand Final if they had to face SKT or EDG before that? I don't.

I want to see the best play the best, and  even with EDG's performance at LPL finals (where they looked like they could have lost almost every game) they are, imho, vastly stronger than EU/NA. Now SKT or GE (I feel it will be SKT but still), are on the same level or above EDG.

If for some reason the brackets are setup to have TSM v Fnatic in the semi finals, I will be pissed (yes I am repeating myself) because that just means another international event that doesn't   push TSM/Fnatic to the limit in the semis and make them work for finals (See IEM Katowice).
